messages.text:
I think we should not remove the Makefile now, because it still has
valuable information
it it.
We are still looking for way to enable this test on Windows, and this
Makefile is a remainder.

Unless we decide not to enable the test on Windows before Go 1, IMO, we
should keep it
until the test is enabled on Windows.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

On Mar 11, 2012 7:28 AM, "minux" <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> I think we should not remove the Makefile now, because it still has
valuable information
> it it.
> We are still looking for way to enable this test on Windows, and this
Makefile is a remainder.
>
> Unless we decide not to enable the test on Windows before Go 1, IMO, we
should keep it
> until the test is enabled on Windows.

Isn't cgo supposed to work the same way, so running "go test" works for
these tests?

On Sun, Mar 11, 2012 at 9:46 PM, Francisco Souza
<franciscossouza@gmail.com>wrote:

> On Mar 11, 2012 7:28 AM, "minux" <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:
> >
> > I think we should not remove the Makefile now, because it still has
> valuable information
> > it it.
> > We are still looking for way to enable this test on Windows, and this
> Makefile is a remainder.
> >
> > Unless we decide not to enable the test on Windows before Go 1, IMO, we
> should keep it
> > until the test is enabled on Windows.
>
> Isn't cgo supposed to work the same way, so running "go test" works for
> these tests?
>
It is, and the Makefile won't be used. But I think it as a remainder of the
problem of enabling
misc/cgo/test on Windows.

Leave it to others to decide this.

On 2012/03/11 14:11:59, minux wrote:

ping?

Hi,

I'd like to keep this Makefile until this directory builds on Windows.

Thanks.
Russ
